verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking unto all the people all the words of the LORD their God, for which the LORD their God had sent him to them, even all these words,
verses.ct: When Jeremiah had finished delivering to all the people every message the LORD their God had given him to share with them —

verses.kjv: Then spake Azariah the son of Hoshaiah, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the proud men, saying unto Jeremiah, Thou speakest falsely: the LORD our God hath not sent thee to say, Go not into Egypt to sojourn there:
verses.ct: Azariah son of Hoshaiah, Johanan son of Kareah, and all the arrogant men spoke up and said to Jeremiah, "You're lying! The LORD our God did not send you to tell us, 'Don't go to Egypt to settle there.'

verses.kjv: But Baruch the son of Neriah setteth thee on against us, for to deliver us into the hand of the Chaldeans, that they might put us to death, and carry us away captives into Babylon.
verses.ct: Instead, Baruch son of Neriah is turning you against us so that we'll be handed over to the Babylonians, who will either kill us or deport us to Babylon."

verses.kjv: So Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, and all the people, obeyed not the voice of the LORD, to dwell in the land of Judah.
verses.ct: So Johanan son of Kareah, all the military commanders, and all the people refused to obey the LORD's command to stay in the land of Judah.

verses.kjv: But Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, took all the remnant of Judah, that were returned from all nations, whither they had been driven, to dwell in the land of Judah;
verses.ct: Instead, Johanan son of Kareah and all the military commanders gathered up the entire remnant of Judah — those who had come back from all the nations where they had been scattered to live in the land of Judah.

verses.kjv: Even men, and women, and children, and the king’s daughters, and every person that Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan, and Jeremiah the prophet, and Baruch the son of Neriah.
verses.ct: This included men, women, children, the king's daughters, and every person that Nebuzaradan the commander of the guard had placed under the care of Gedaliah son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan — along with Jeremiah the prophet and Baruch son of Neriah.

verses.kjv: So they came into the land of Egypt: for they obeyed not the voice of the LORD: thus came they even to Tahpanhes.
verses.ct: They traveled to Egypt because they refused to obey the LORD's command. They went all the way to Tahpanhes.

verses.kjv: Then came the word of the LORD unto Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke to Jeremiah at Tahpanhes:

verses.kjv: Take great stones in thine hand, and hide them in the clay in the brickkiln, which is at the entry of Pharaoh’s house in Tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of Judah;
verses.ct: "Pick up some large stones and bury them in the mortar of the brick pavement at the entrance to Pharaoh's palace in Tahpanhes, while the people of Judah are watching.

verses.kjv: And say unto them, Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will send and take Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will set his throne upon these stones that I have hid; and he shall spread his royal pavilion over them.
verses.ct: Then tell them, 'This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: Pay attention — I am going to summon my servant Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and I will place his throne right over these stones that I have buried. He will set up his royal canopy above them.

verses.kjv: And when he cometh, he shall smite the land of Egypt, and deliver such as are for death to death; and such as are for captivity to captivity; and such as are for the sword to the sword.
verses.ct: When he arrives, he will attack the land of Egypt. Those destined for death will die, those destined for captivity will be taken captive, and those destined for the sword will fall by the sword.

verses.kjv: And I will kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt; and he shall burn them, and carry them away captives: and he shall array himself with the land of Egypt, as a shepherd putteth on his garment; and he shall go forth from thence in peace.
verses.ct: I will set fire to the temples of Egypt's gods, and Nebuchadrezzar will burn them down and carry off the idols. He will wrap himself in the land of Egypt the way a shepherd puts on his coat, and then he will leave there unharmed.

verses.kjv: He shall break also the images of Bethshemesh, that is in the land of Egypt; and the houses of the gods of the Egyptians shall he burn with fire.
verses.ct: He will shatter the sacred pillars of the temple of the sun in Egypt, and he will burn down the temples of Egypt's gods with fire.'"
